intro: Lhotskya, commonly known as the Himalayan snowbell, is a genus of flowering plants native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers, which are typically white or pale blue. The plants are evergreen shrubs with lance-shaped leaves and produce small, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring. Lhotskya species are adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil. They are often found in rocky habitats and are valued for their ornamental beauty in horticulture.
